etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French dars (see dart)

definitions: a small freshwater fish of the minnow family, typically living in running water.

notes.text: Leuciscus and numerous other genera, family Cyprinidae: several species, including the longfin dace (Agosia chrysogaster) of western North America and the widely distributed L. leuciscus of northern Eurasia

shortDefinitions: small freshwater fish related to carp
